text: LCI. Uit de fles geschonken. Wist niet wat ik moest verwachten van dit bier. Bleek een rokerig en kruidig bier te zijn, niet voor iedereen bestemd. Ik vond hem lekker, hou wel van dit soort bijzondere smaakcombis.

Had this a while back, apparently never rated it: clear copper amber colour, white head. Aroma of peat smoke, juniper, quite sweet, malty, caramel, light fruity. Flavour follows, sweet smoky barley wine with some citrusy juniper. Bitter finish. Medium bodied.

33cl bottle at home. Pours a hazy red amber colour with a medium creamy white head which quickly recedes to a thin layer on top. Aroma of peated malt, yeast, citrus, juniper berries, smoked salmon, peach. Taste is medium sweet, medium botter with moderate dry finish. Notes of caramel, smoked/peated malts, juniper berries, peach, citrus. Texture is thick, medium to full bodied with soft carbonation
Flesje gedeeld tijdens proeverijtje. Gelig, roodachtig helder bier. Aroma van gerookte ham . Smaak is rokerig en zoet. Nasmaak is iets bitter.
Fles gedeeld door Benzai, geprobeerd met Inoven, Roelzie1986 en Dutchdrebus. Het is een goudgeel bier met weinig schuim. Het heeft een duidelijke rooksmaak.
Bottle @ benzai. Clear golden orange colour with a small white head. Smells smokey, salty, bacon. Tastes smokey, sweet, bacon. Full body, soft carbo.

Bottle, pours clear dark golden with a white head. Light smoke, herbal, peach, juniper berries, rye, wood, heather, lemon. Moderate sweet, light sour, slick mouth coating texture, full bodied. Interesting and good.
Slight acidic, bit also oak. Fresh. Wild yeasts. Some herbs. I like it, although it is clearly not standard. Oak. Quote o.k..

kruidige gist, bacon en rook redelijk subtiel, beetje appel of zoiets estherigs... zoet en flink bitter, beetje zout ook... flink aan de carbs... flinke body... bittere en gistige afdronk... interessant allemaal.. mooi diep oranje ook

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: hazy dark straw with visible solid particles and a medium off-white head. Aroma: smoke / smoked salmon, apricot, spices, juniper, some caramel and a hint of metal. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of smoke, white grapes, green apple, rye, brown sugar. The finish is long and smoky. Alcohol is well hidden. Palate: medium bodied, thick oily texture and soft carbonation.
Bottle 0,33: Hazy amber colored brew with an sweet bitter taste and some smokiness. Hints of juniper in a good way.
0,33l lfes gedeeld met bryan. Amber met een creme kraag. heerlijk vol rookbier. Met bacon, rook zonder echt te overwelvend te worden. topper

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 Oranjegeel, minimale schuimkraag, troebel en iets koolzuur zichtbaar. Aroma: Gerookt bacon, kruidig maar daaronder een zoetige karamel aroma met kruidige rogge mouten.Smaak: Lekker zoet en vol... dit verwachte ik niet. Een mooie gerookte hint, bacon, met een zoetige en moutige smaak. Roggebrood met suiker, lichte bitter en ook een fruitig zuurtje van de jeneverbes. Alcohol merk je iets... een lichte warmte. Voor 10% toch mooi op de achtergrond.Volle body, romig mondgevoel en bitterzoet met een gerookte hint in de nasmaak.Prima!

33cl bottle shared with maakun and Kermis.
Thin white head. Very hazy golden pour. Very good.

Bottle shared. Slight hazy golden with off white head. Smoke, light bacon, light herbs, dried berries, sweet rye bread, lots of sweet malts, bready, light marzipan, twigs, straw. Quite sweet and light bitter. Almost full bodied.

Bottle shared thanks to Maakun. Slight hazy amber with a small off white head. Aroma of smoky bacon, bacon crisps, caramel and malt. Flavour is heavy sweet. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle at home, orange beer, small/medium head. Aroma is smoke, smoked ham, caramel. Taste is the same, sweet, some alcohol. nice one
Bottle. Orange golden pour. Aroma of smoke, wood berries, malt, caramel and yeast. Sweet taste of caramelly smoke, juniper, weird cloying vanilla-ish and herbs from the forest. Strange.

(Jopen Many Faced Got) Bottle 330ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 10%
Deep copper orange colour on the body, cloudy, with a small and thin off-white head on top, low retention.
Aroma has smoke, thyme, sugars.
The taste is sweet and slightly smokey, with sugars, malts, notable alcohol, smoked meats.
Medium thin body, good carbonation.
Nice one.

Bottle, BB 03.08.2018 (from het biermoment). Pours amber. Aroma is sweet, smoke, fruits, banana. Flavor is Flavor is sweet and bitter, wheat, smoke, caramel, malt, bacon, some sour fruity notes, juniper maybe. Drinkability is ok, although there is noticeable alcohol in the finish. Overall: ok, although I suspect that its not really like proper gotlandsdricka...

33cl. Appearance: A bit unclear orange body, with an average sized white to off-white head. Aroma: light malts, rye, junipers, smoke.
Taste: moderate sweet with a nice pallet of smoke tones, juniperberries, rye. Gentle bitter finish, with only some warmth (only a trace of alcohol)
medium body,slightly above average carbonation.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear orange to copper with a small to medium white head and an aroma of smoked salmon, roasted malts, toffee, yeast, raspberries, rye, juniper and maple syrup. The taste is medium sweet with lots of smokey notes and juniper notes, the alcohol is very well hidden. The finish is smokey bitter and medium lasting. Very nice beer!

Bottle 0.33l at Jopen Proeflokaal Waarderpolder Haarlem, The Netherlands. 22.09.2016. Taste with Vlada Ciaone. Pour it dark hazy amber color with no head. Aroma smoked ham. Taste sweet caramel, candy sugar, buttery in the middle, smoked nice pleasent not agressive, licorice just a touch, nice balanced, interesting style, medium to full body, average to lively carbonation, long sweet finish. I liked it.

Bottle from Biernavigatie, BB 03 Aug 2018, large sample. Hazy orange to amber color, short frothy head. Aroma is flowery, juniper berries, wood, slight minerally. Minerally in taste, bit dry wood, juniper, alcoholic. Feels more like a tripel or belgian pale strong with some added juniper berries and -twigs. Decent and tasty beer, but the imperial part doesnt seem to add a lot.

Bottle shared with Erwin Van Moll @ Brewpub Van Moll. A bit unclear orange color, average sized white to off-white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, rye, smoke, smoked bacon a little and a little bitter. Actually quite decent.
Bottle. Reddsih golden color. Beechwood, twigs, smoke and juniper in the aroma. Malty sweet flavor with red fruit, juniper, beechwood smoke. Slightly alcoholic but pleasant.
Smoky, it is. A bit the aroma of smiked paprika or bacon. Rye coming through clearly. Odd.
from bottle, poured a murky deep amber colour with a tanned head. nose of caramel malts, toffee, yeast, sweet berries, spiced rye, cacao. sticky full mouthfeel

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, Weizen yeast, banana, honey, juniper, grain, smoke and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid amber/orange beer with a slight off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Weizen yeast, banana, honey and juniper; ends slightly bitter and dry with smoke and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. The first thing I noticed in this beer is the Weizen yeast, but it is so much more complex than that. That juniper berries are so noticeable and tasty in this beer. That slight smoke at the end wraps it up perfectly. The palate is thicker than would be expected with every sip.

33cl bottle at home. Pale brown with a small slightly off-white head. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Herbal sweetness with some smoke and bitterness. Caramel, roasted malts, juniper, ripe fruits, herbs, spices and honey. Weird but nice.
